Clears the entire text mode screen and resets the cursor to 0 0 Clears the entire text mode screen and resets the cursor to 0 0

A custom implementation of the standard printf function for writing to VGA text mode memory A custom implementation of the standard printf function for writing to VGA text mode memory This function formats a string and prints it to the screen handling various format specifiers flags width precision and length modifiers It returns the total number of characters written format The format string Variable arguments corresponding to the format specifiers The total number of characters written to the screen Supported Format Specifiers c Character s String d i Signed decimal integer u Unsigned decimal integer f Floating point number double x Unsigned hexadecimal integer lowercase X Unsigned hexadecimal integer uppercase b Unsigned binary integer o Unsigned octal integer p Pointer address A literal character Supported Flags Alternative form e.g 0 x for hex 0 for octal 0 Zero-padding for width Supported Width A number after specifies the minimum field width e.g 1 0 d Supported Precision A period followed by a number specifies precision e.g 4 f 8 X For integers this specifies the minimum number of digits to print Supported Length Modifiers h short int for d i u x X o b hh signed/unsigned char for d i u x X o b l long int ll long long int

Manages the Interrupt Descriptor Table IDT and Programmable Interrupt Controllers PICs dispatching interrupts to registered handlers
Enables interrupts globally by executing the sti instruction

The central interrupt dispatching function called by assembly stubs interruptNumber The number of the interrupt that occurred esp The stack pointer Extended Stack Pointer from the context of the interrupted process The updated stack pointer typically the same as the input unless the handler modified the stack frame

Disables interrupts globally by executing the cli instruction

Populates a specific entry in the Interrupt Descriptor Table IDT interruptNumber The index of the IDT entry to set 0 2 5 5 codeSegmentSelectorOffset The segment selector for the interrupt handler code handler A function pointer to the assembly stub that handles the interrupt DescriptorPrivilegeLever The DPL Descriptor Privilege Level for the interrupt gate DescriptorType The type of the descriptor e.g 0 xE for 3 2 bit Interrupt Gate
Command port for the Slave PIC 8 2 5 9 A

The compiler requires these functions to be defined to handle memory allocation and deallocation especially for classes with virtual destructors Since we are not linking the standard library we must provide our own For now they don t have to do anything Overload of the new operator stub size The size of memory to allocate Always returns nullptr as this is a stub
Overload of the delete operator stub ptr Pointer to the array memory to deallocate
Overload of the new operator stub size The size of memory to allocate for the array Always returns nullptr as this is a stub
Overload of the delete operator with size stub ptr Pointer to the array memory to deallocate size The size of the memory block
Overload of the delete operator with size stub ptr Pointer to the memory to deallocate size The size of the memory block
Overload of the delete operator stub ptr Pointer to the memory to deallocate

Constructs a GDT_Row Segment Descriptor with specified parameters base The 3 2 bit base address of the segment limit The 2 0 bit limit size of the segment access_byte The 8 bit access flags for the segment gran_byte The 8 bit granularity flags for the segment

Executes registered destructors/cleanup functions Executes registered destructors/cleanup functions f If non-null only destructors associated with this function pointer are called If null all registered destructors are called in reverse order of registration

(unsigned long long n, char *buffer, int base, int is_signed, int uppercase)

Converts an unsigned long long integer to a string n The number to convert buffer The output buffer to store the string base The numerical base e.g 2 8 1 0 1 6 is_signed Whether the original number was signed for handling negative sign uppercase Whether to use uppercase letters for bases 1 0
Internal function to print a null-terminated string to video memory str The string to print
Reverses a string in place str The string to reverse length The length of the string
Calculates the power of a number base The base exp The exponent The result of base raised to the power of exp
Prints a hexadecimal number with leading zeros n The number to print digits The total number of digits to print padded with zeros
Converts a double-precision floating point number to a string d The double to convert buffer The output buffer to store the string precision The number of digits after the decimal point
